Kemp wrote that while TTD's shares have sold off in the wake of Facebook Inc.'s FB, -1.58% Cambridge Analytica scandal, the "debacle has little relevance for TTD," which doesn't buy ads on Facebook or use Facebook data.

Kemp thinks that only 14% of the "true addressable ad volume" is currently being conducted via programmatic channels but believes that this share could grow to the mid-20% range by 2022, benefiting TTD.
Shares of ad technology company Trade Desk Inc. TTD, -5.85% are up 4.2% in premarket trading Thursday after Piper Jaffray analyst Sam Kemp initiated coverage of the stock with an overweight rating.

Kemp has a $63 price target on TTD shares, which are up 29% in the past 12 months, compared with a 12% rise for the S&P 500 SPX, -2.33%

The sell-off has created an "attractive entry point," he wrote.
